"In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana," Mike Pence said in a letter to supporters first reported Thursday by the Indianapolis Star. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012. Mike Pence has been publicly pondering whether to run for the governor's office or for president for several months. would be a step too far, but the U.S. would certainly need to extend its commitment to the conventional defense of the states bordering Iran. In July 2009, Donald Rumsfeld of State Hillary Clinton explicitly admitted this: We want Iran to calculate what I think is a fair assessment that if the United States extends a defense umbrella over the region, if we do even more to support the military capacity of those in the Gulf, it's unlikely that Iran will be any stronger or safer because they won't be able to intimidate and dominate as they apparently believe they can once they have a nuclear weapon.[ 20] A policy of containment thus implies that the U.S. will expand its military presence in the Persian Gulf.
